issue.title: Schema does not initialize defaults in nested objects

labels.name: model
labels.description: Related to swagger generate model command

issue.body:
## Problem statement
Whenever a schema declares a default value, the corresponding generated structure is properly initialized, like in:
```yaml
parameters:
  - in: body
    name: myBodyParam
    schema:
      type: object
      properties:
        p1: 
          type: string
        p2:
           type: integer
      default:
        p1: abc
        p2: 12
```

However, when defaults are declared at a lower level, no initialization takes place, as in:
```yaml
parameters:
  - in: body
    name: myBodyParam
    schema:
      type: object
      properties:
        p1: 
          type: string
          default: abc
        p2:
          type: integer
          default: 12
```

It looks like the "schema" term used in the [json schema spec](https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fge-json-schema-validation-00#section-6.2) has been taken to the letter, making it equivalent to the swagger schema term.


## Steps to reproduce
generate server with structures proposed  as examples and submit uninitialized body

## Environment
swagger version: x.x.x  
go version: x.x.x  
OS:

body:
Same here: for any body param with simple type, no validation is generated.
It works when forcing a model to be generated (e.g. using $ref: ...)

issue.title: Generated server does not validate input

labels.name: validator
labels.description: Related to codegen generation of validations

issue.body:
## Problem statement

According to the docs here https://goswagger.io/use/server.html#your-own-code

> Every incoming request is described as a bunch of input parameters which have been validated prior to calling the handler. So whenever your code is executed, the input parameters are guaranteed to be valid according to what the swagger specification prescribes.

However, in practice the server generated does not actually validate input. I'm able to not specify required properties `resource_type` or `resource_id`, or even send an empty body and the code path still reaches my route handler.


## Swagger specification
```yaml
paths:
  /resource_schema:
    put:
      tags: [ResourceSchema]
      description: Find or create a `ResourceSchema` based on the resource's type and id
      parameters:
        - in: body
          name: input
          required: true
          schema:
            type: object
            properties:
              resource_type: { $ref: '#/definitions/ResourceType' }
              resource_id: { type: string }
            required: [resource_type, resource_id]
      responses:
        200:
          description: Success
          schema: { $ref: '#/definitions/ResourceSchema' }
```

## Steps to reproduce

```
swagger generate server -t servers/go
go run servers/go/cmd/schema-service-server/main.go
```

Then make a request to the server, such as
```
curl -X PUT "http://localhost:60223/v1/resource_schema" -H "accept: application/json" -H "content-type: application/json" -d "{}"
```



## Environment
swagger version: dev (latest master as of time of issue)
go version go1.8.1 darwin/amd64
OS: macOS 10.12.5 (16F73)

issue.title: Nested objects in array are not validated

labels.name: model
labels.description: Related to swagger generate model command

issue.title: Enable validation for inline body parameters
issue.body:
* fixes #1392
* fixes #1095
* fixes #1093
* fixes #1376 (added fixture to confirm correction with previous change)
* address issues with enum as slice validations in parameters

issue.title: No validation is called when the object referring to the array type parameter
issue.body:
## Problem statement
The issue is similar to the Issue #1392 and #1093 but not the same.
When the body parameter is an under properties in object type, referencing array data type, none of the validation is called. But if we mark the body parameter required, the validation will show in the auto-generated code.

## Swagger specification
**Case : 1**
```yaml
profileCfg: 
           type: object
           properties:
               value1:
                   type: integer
                   format: int32
              value2:
                  type: integer
                  format: int32                    
profileCfgs:
           type: array
           x-omitempty: true
           items:
              $ref: '#definitions/profileCfg'
Profile:
           type: object
           properties: 
                  profileCfg:
                       $ref: '#definitions/profileCfgs'
```

**Case: 2**
```yaml
profileCfg: 
           type: object
           properties:
               value1:
                   type: integer
                   format: int32
              value2:
                  type: integer
                  format: int32                    
profileCfgs:
           type: array
           x-omitempty: true
           items:
              $ref: '#definitions/profileCfg'
Profile:
           type: object
           required:
               - profileCfg
           properties: 
                  profileCfg:
                       $ref: '#definitions/profileCfgs'
```

**Case 3**

```yaml
profileCfg: 
           type: object
           properties:
               value1:
                   type: integer
                   format: int32
              value2:
                  type: integer
                  format: int32            
Profile:
           type: object
           required:
               - profileCfg
           properties: 
                  profileCfg:
                       type: array
                       x-omitempty: true
                       items:
                         $ref: '#definitions/profileCfg'
```
                    
## Steps to reproduce

Generate the server based on this swagger
In the Case1, the validation will not be generated.

```go
func (m *Profile) Validate(formats strfmt.Registry) error {
        var res []error
        if len(res) > 0 {
                              return errors
        }
         return nil
}
```

In the Case2, the validation will be generated successfully.

```go
func (m *profile) Validate(formats strfmt.Registry) error {
      var res []error
      if err := m.validateProfile(formats); err != nil {
                res = append(res, err)
      }
     if len(res) > 0 {
                              return errors
        }
         return nil
}
```

In the Case3, if we remove the refer to the array struct, and without mark the area required the validation will still be generated same as the code in the Case 2. (Case 3 validation generation is by the fix in the issue #1392 and #1093.

So I think there may an issue that I have to mark the parameter required which it referring to the array struct if I want the validation to generate. Thanks very much for your help!

## Environment
swagger version: 0.13.0
go version: go1.10.2 linux/amd64
OS:  Linux Centos
